Quartz.description: A transparent crystal with multiple facets. It emits a soft and soothing glow, known for its healing and purifying properties.

Feldspar.description: A crystalline rock with various hues. Known for its ability to amplify magical powers, but can cause dizziness when handled for too long.

Calcite.description: A shiny stone with multiple colors, often used to stabilize emotions. However, prolonged exposure can cause headaches.

Gypsum.description: A soft stone, used for centuries to promote relaxation and mental clarity. However, excessive use can lead to dehydration.

Mica.description: A shiny mineral often found in thin sheets. Known for its reflective properties, but prolonged exposure can cause skin irritation.

Pyrite.description: A metallic mineral with a brassy yellow color. It's often mistaken for gold due to its appearance, but it can cause respiratory issues when powdered.

Amphibole.description: A group of dark-colored minerals with long, thin crystals. Known for their ability to enhance intuition, but they can also induce nausea in sensitive individuals.

Chalcedony.description: A cryptocrystalline form of silica, composed of fine intergrowths of both quartz and moganite. It's believed to enhance communication skills but may cause insomnia if used excessively.

Dolomite.description: A mineral consisting of calcium magnesium carbonate, often found in sedimentary rocks. It's known for its calming effects, but overuse may lead to digestive issues.

Halite.description: Also known as rock salt, halite is a mineral composed primarily of sodium chloride. It's used for purification rituals, but excessive exposure may lead to dehydration.

Olivine.description: A green mineral found in igneous rocks. It's believed to bring luck and prosperity, but prolonged contact with the skin may cause irritation.

Geode.description: A hollow rock filled with crystals or other minerals. Geodes are often used for meditation and spiritual healing, but their energy can be overwhelming for some.

Serpentine.description: A group of green minerals often used for carving. It's believed to have protective properties, but it may cause dizziness if handled for too long.

Hematite.description: A metallic gray mineral with a reddish tint. It's often used for grounding and protection, but it may cause constipation if ingested.

Barite.description: A heavy mineral composed of barium sulfate. It's used in various industries, but prolonged exposure can lead to respiratory problems.

Fluorite.description: A colorful mineral known for its fluorescence under ultraviolet light. It's believed to enhance focus and concentration, but excessive use may cause confusion.

Aragonite.description: A mineral form of calcium carbonate, often found in sea shells and pearls. It's believed to promote patience and acceptance, but it may cause lethargy if overused.

Malachite.description: A green copper carbonate mineral. It's often associated with protection and transformation, but prolonged exposure may cause digestive issues.

Tourmaline.description: A crystal with various colors, often used for energy purification and protection. However, it may cause insomnia if placed near the bed.

Zinc Sulfide.description: A compound mineral consisting of zinc and sulfur. It's used in various applications, but inhalation of its dust may cause respiratory issues.

Amazonite.description: A blue-green variety of microcline feldspar. It's believed to promote courage and communication, but it may cause mood swings if overused.

Apatite.description: A group of phosphate minerals, often used in the manufacture of fertilizers. It's believed to enhance creativity and intellect, but it may cause overstimulation if used excessively.

Garnet.description: A group of silicate minerals with a deep red color. Garnets are often associated with passion and vitality, but they may cause irritability if worn for too long.

Pyroxene.description: A group of dark-colored minerals found in igneous and metamorphic rocks. Pyroxenes are believed to provide strength and protection, but they may cause restlessness if used excessively.

Bauxite.description: An aluminum-rich rock used for the production of aluminum. It's believed to promote perseverance and resilience, but it may cause irritability if ingested.

Beryl.description: A mineral family including aquamarine, emerald, and others. Beryls are believed to bring harmony and balance, but they may cause lethargy if worn for too long.

Lapis Lazuli.description: A deep blue metamorphic rock used as a gemstone for centuries. Lapis lazuli is believed to enhance wisdom and insight, but it may cause melancholy if overused.

Corundum.description: A crystalline form of aluminum oxide, including rubies and sapphires. Corundum is believed to bring protection and good fortune, but it may cause arrogance if overused.

Nacre.description: Also known as mother of pearl, nacre is an iridescent material produced by mollusks. It's believed to bring calmness and tranquility, but it may cause forgetfulness if overused.

Jade.description: A green ornamental stone, often used in jewelry and carvings. Jade is believed to promote harmony and balance, but it may cause stubbornness if overused.

Sphalerite.description: A zinc sulfide mineral with variable amounts of iron. Sphalerite is believed to enhance vitality and confidence, but it may cause impulsiveness if overused.

Obsidian.description: A naturally occurring volcanic glass formed as an extrusive igneous rock. Obsidian is believed to provide protection and grounding, but it may cause negativity if used excessively.

Peridot.description: A green gemstone formed deep within the Earth's mantle. Peridot is believed to bring warmth and openness, but it may cause jealousy if overused.

Aquamarine.description: A blue-green variety of the mineral beryl. Aquamarine is believed to bring courage and clarity, but it may cause indecision if overused.

Spinel.description: A gemstone often mistaken for rubies or sapphires. Spinel is believed to bring energy and vitality, but it may cause recklessness if overused.

Lead Sulfide.description: A compound mineral consisting of lead and sulfur. It's used in various applications, but inhalation of its dust may cause respiratory issues.

Opal.description: A gemstone known for its iridescence and play-of-color. Opal is believed to enhance creativity and spontaneity, but it may cause mood swings if overused.

Titanite.description: A calcium titanium silicate mineral, often found as translucent crystals. Titanite is believed to bring harmony and balance, but it may cause stubbornness if overused.

Topaz.description: A yellow, orange, or brown gemstone often used in jewelry. Topaz is believed to bring joy and abundance, but it may cause overindulgence if overused.

Turquoise.description: A blue to green mineral, often used in jewelry and decorative items. Turquoise is believed to bring protection and good fortune, but it may cause mood swings if overused.

Ruby.description: A red variety of the mineral corundum. Rubies are believed to bring passion and vitality, but they may cause impulsiveness if overused.

Emerald.description: A green gemstone, one of the four precious stones along with diamond, ruby, and sapphire. Emeralds are believed to bring hope and renewal, but they may cause jealousy if overused.

Kunzite.description: A pink to light violet gemstone, often used in jewelry. Kunzite is believed to bring love and emotional healing, but it may cause mood swings if overused.

Zircon.description: A mineral belonging to the group of nesosilicates, often used as a gemstone. Zircon is believed to bring clarity and protection, but it may cause stubbornness if overused.

Rhodochrosite.description: A manganese carbonate mineral with a pink coloration. Rhodochrosite is believed to bring love and compassion, but it may cause mood swings if overused.

Amethyst.description: A purple variety of quartz, often used in jewelry. Amethyst is believed to bring clarity and spiritual protection, but it may cause lethargy if overused.

Quartz Crystal.description: A clear or milky white crystal, often used for its healing properties. Quartz crystals are believed to amplify energy and intuition, but they may cause headaches if overused.

Peridotite.description: A coarse-grained igneous rock consisting mostly of olivine. Peridotite is believed to bring transformation and renewal, but it may cause stubbornness if overused.

Platinum.description: A dense, malleable, and ductile precious metal. Platinum is believed to bring wealth and prosperity, but it may cause greed if overused.

Diamond.description: A precious gemstone composed of pure carbon. Diamonds are believed to bring clarity and enlightenment, but they may cause arrogance if overused.
